Package entity

Class PacmanEntity

java.lang.Object
entity.Entity
entity.PacmanEntity
All Implemented Interfaces:
CollisionElement, EngineComponent
public class PacmanEntity
extends Entity
implements CollisionElement
The PacmanEntity handles the drawing, animations, collisions, pickups, etc of the player/pacman.

      player - The player instance attached to this entity
      x - The X position of the pacman entity
      y - The Y position of the pacman entity

    • changeDirection

      public void changeDirection​(Entity.DIRECTION direction)

      Parameters:
      direction - The new direction of movement

    • collidedWithGameBoundary

      public boolean collidedWithGameBoundary​(java.awt.Rectangle collisionBox, CollisionController.COLLISION_TYPE collisionType)
      This method is called when the pacman entity attempts to move through a part of the game boundary; as in any WALLS. A collision with the edge of the game space allows the pacman to teleport through to the other side of the map. Hence, collisionBox can either be a wall, or the boundary of the game. Depending on which we receive, this function will either STOP the entity from moving, or will transport the entity to the other end of the map.
      Specified by:
      collidedWithGameBoundary in interface CollisionElement
      Parameters:
      collisionBox - The collision box intersecting the boundary.
      collisionType - The collision type we're responding to, EDGE or WALL.
      Returns:
      True if the collision event is consumed, false otherwise.

    • isCollisionBoxIntersecting

      public java.awt.Rectangle isCollisionBoxIntersecting​(java.awt.Rectangle collision, CollisionElement source)
      Tests if the provided collision box is intersecting with this entity. If the collision box originated from this entity, null is returned. If not, this entities infringed collision box is returned if a collision occurred, null otherwise.
      Specified by:
      isCollisionBoxIntersecting in interface CollisionElement
      Parameters:
      collision - The collision box to test against
      source - The source of the collision box
      Returns:
      Returns the collision boundary of this entity if a collision is present, null otherwise.

      public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Returns a rectangle containing the boundary of this entity.
      Specified by:
      getBounds in interface CollisionElement
      Returns:
      A bounding rectangle
